course_description: This course develops the theory of resource and environmental economics and applies it to analyze real-world policy issues. It covers the economics of exhaustible and renewable resources and discusses how economic approaches can be used to control externalities and pollution.
prerequisites: This course requires ECON 201 OR ECON_OX201 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 6473, Section #: 9000, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Does Not Meet, Instructor: Staff, Status: Closed
